title.value: Consciousness in Artificial Intelligence: Insights from the Science of Consciousness
title.justification: The title mentioned in the user's prompt and throughout the content
title.quote: Consciousness in Artificial Intelligence: Insights from the Science of Consciousness

extractions.description: This report argues for a rigorous and empirically grounded approach to AI consciousness: assessing existing AI systems in detail, in light of our best-supported neuroscientific theories of consciousness.

type.justification: The paper systematically evaluates current AI systems against empirical neuroscientific theories of consciousness.
type.quote: This report argues for, and exemplifies, a rigorous and empirically grounded approach to AI consciousness: assessing existing AI systems in detail, in light of our best-supported neuroscientific theories of consciousness.

primary_research_field.justification: The paper discusses the implementation of neuroscientific theories of consciousness within deep learning frameworks and evaluates current AI models.
primary_research_field.quote: We survey several prominent scientific theories of consciousness, including recurrent processing theory, global workspace theory, higherorder theories, predictive processing, and attention schema theory.

sub_research_fields.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on understanding and assessing AI systems for consciousness based on deep learning and neuroscience.
sub_research_fields.quote: Our method for studying consciousness in AI has three main tenets.

name.justification: The Perceiver is evaluated concerning its implementation of self-attention and its applicability to global workspace theory.
name.quote: The Perceiver architecture allows for sequences of inputs to be processed diachronically, with the latent space state updating with each new input, but also influenced by its previous state.

caracteristics.justification: Perceiver is a neural network model designed to handle input from multiple domains or modalities.
caracteristics.quote: Perceiver: General perception with iterative attention.

name.justification: Transformers are discussed for their architecture featuring self-attention and potential similarities to global workspace theory.
name.quote: In a Transformer, an operation called 'self-attention' is used to integrate information from different parts of an input, which are often positions in a sequence.

caracteristics.justification: Transformers are a type of neural network extensively discussed for their self-attention mechanism.
caracteristics.quote: Transformers consist of a stack of layers of two types, which alternate: layers of attention heads, which perform the self-attention operation, moving information between positions, and feedforward layers.

name.justification: The PaLM-E multilodal model is discussed for its integration of visual and textual inputs to generate outputs, potentially illustrating features of agency and embodiment.
name.quote: PaLM-E generates high-level plans while the policy unit provides low-level vision-guided motor control.

caracteristics.justification: PaLM-E is a Transformer-based model that combines language processing with multimodal inputs.
caracteristics.quote: PaLM-E is a decoder-only LLM (Driess et al. 2023), fine-tuned from PaLM.

name.justification: AdA uses reinforcement learning for complex task execution in a simulated environment, illustrating elements of agency and adaptive behavior.
name.quote: AdA is a large Transformer-based, RL-trained 'adaptive agent'.

caracteristics.justification: It's explicitly mentioned that AdA is trained via reinforcement learning.
caracteristics.quote: AdA, DeepMindâ€™s adaptive agent, is also trained end-to-end by RL to control an avatar in a 3D virtual environment.

name.justification: The Virtual Rodent is examined for learning and embodying physical interactions within a simulated environment.
name.quote: The 'virtual rodent' of Merel et al. (2019) is a promising candidate for these attributes.

caracteristics.justification: The Virtual Rodent is a reinforcement learning model trained to perform tasks in a simulated environment.
caracteristics.quote: A recurrent LSTM-based actor-critic architecture was trained end-to-end by RL to control this body.

name.justification: PyTorch is commonly used in training and implementing various deep learning models discussed in the paper.
TensorFlow is another prominent deep learning library used for implementing models discussed.
